variables.description: Boolean if the styles for tabs with a label and an icon should be included.
Boolean if the styles for wrapping a toolbar and tabs together should be included.

see.description: Includes the styles for toolbars that have tabs as well.

context.name: react-md-tabbed-toolbars

variables.description:
Boolean if the styles for offsetting content from a prominent toolbar and tabs
should be included.

Boolean if the styles for a pagination tab overflow on desktop screens should
be included.
Boolean if the styles for a menu tab overflow on desktop screens should be included.
Boolean if the mobile swipeable styles should be included.
The height for a tab with only a label or only an icon.

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for a tab only. This should probably not be used since it
is included in the `react-md-tabs` mixin.

context.name: react-md-tabs-tab

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for the swipeable views as well as some offset classes for
positioning the tabs content.

context.name: react-md-tabs-swipeable

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for tabs on mobile devices that are portrait.
This really only adds styles for offsetting the tabs content when there is
a toolbar. No styles will be included if the `$include-toolbars` or `$include-swipeable`
params are `false`.

This mixin will define some offset class names to position the tabs content.
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-icon`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-prominent`

context.name: react-md-tabs-mobile-portrait

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for tabs on mobile devices that are landscape.
This really only adds styles for offsetting the tabs content when there is
a toolbar. No styles will be included if the `$include-toolbars` or `$include-swipeable`
params are `false`.

This mixin will define some offset class names to position the tabs content.
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-icon`

context.name: react-md-tabs-mobile-landscape

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for tabs on tablet devices. This really only adds styles for offsetting
the tabs content when there is a toolbar. No styles will be included if the `$include-toolbars`
or `$include-swipeable` params are `false`.

This mixin will define some offset class names to position the tabs content.
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-icon`

variables.description:
The absolute maximum width for a tab. A tab's width is either the view's width - 56px
or this value; whichever is smaller.

react-md-tabs

parameter.name: secondary-color
parameter.description:
The app's secondary color. This is used
  to style the active tab indicator.

parameter.name: include-media
parameter.description:
Boolean if the media queries should be included
  with this mixin.

parameter.name: include-icons
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for a tab with a label
  and an icon should be included.

parameter.name: include-toolbars
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for a simple container
  holding a toolbar and tabs should be included.

parameter.name: include-prominent-toolbars
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles
  for the simple container holding a toolbar and tabs should include the prominent toolbar styles.

parameter.name: include-pagination-overflow
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles
  for desktop pagination overflow should be included.

parameter.name: include-menu-overflow
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for a drop down menu
  tab overflow on desktop screens should be included.

parameter.name: include-swipeable
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for swiping the tab
  content on mobile devices should be included.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
Updates the theme for tabs only if the `$secondary-color` does not equal the `$md-secondary-color`.
This really changes the color of the tab indicator.

context.name: react-md-theme-tabs

parameter.name: secondary-color
parameter.description: The secondary app color to theme with.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything

Includes the styles for a tab only. This should probably not be used since it

mixins.description:
Includes the styles for tabs on mobile devices that are portrait.
This really only adds styles for offsetting the tabs content when there is
a toolbar. No styles will be included if the `$include-toolbars` or `$include-swipeable`
params are `false`.

This mixin will define some offset class names to position the tabs content.
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-icon`
- `.md-tabs-content--offset-toolbar-prominent`

parameter.name: include-icons
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for offsetting the
    tabs content when there is a tab with both a label and an icon.

parameter.name: include-toolbars
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles for offsetting
    the tabs content when there is a `.md-tabs-container` containing both a toolbar and tabs.

parameter.name: include-prominent-toolbars
parameter.description:
Boolean if the styles
  for offsetting the tabs content when there is a `.md-tabs-container` containing both a prominent toolbar
  and tabs.

parameter.name: include-swipeable
parameter.description: Boolean if the tab's content is swipeable.

usedBy.description: Creates all the styles for tabs at different media sizes.
